all the rules...

I don't care about if there are modded or unmodded versions. I just want to see a veichle that looks like the real SkyCar and that works with the few following rules:

\* Minimal wings - as you can se by the picture

\* VTOL capable

\* Must be flown by at least one Kerbal

\* Range enough to go to the Island and back to KSC.

\* No propellers.

Would be great to roam planets and MÃƒÂ¼ns without the need to following the terrain.

The challenge of building a Skycar is how closely one adheres to the aesthetics and scale of real-world models, which is severely limited with stock parts, including the lack of rotating axles. This craft is completely stock and operated in stock aero. Only informational mods were used during construction (RCS Build Aid) and operation (KER and Advanced Resource Panel).

Moller also said Ã¢â‚¬Å“A VTOL, like a hummingbird, has a high metabolism, which means it requires a lot of energy. It is very difficult...to get a large amount of power in a small package.Ã¢â‚¬Â This model uses a pair of jets tucked almost out of sight for hovering, a pair for forward thrust and another pair for retro thrust. Takeoff can be horizontal with the hover jets gradually lifting off, or vertical with the forward jets transitioning to horizontal flight.

The Moller M400 has 8 engines, 4 computers, and 2 parachutes. This one uses 6 engines, 2 computers and 1 parachute. This parachute was tested many times and the pilots survived every time it deployed. They also survived many RUDs when the chute was not deployed.
